concise_definition: v. 干预, 介入, 插手

definitions.explanation_en: To become involved in a situation in order to change its course, especially when it is problematic or potentially harmful, often by a third party.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在某种情况（尤其是有问题或可能有害的情况）中介入，以改变其发展轨迹，通常由第三方采取行动。
definitions.example_en: The government intervened to prevent the collapse of the banking system.
definitions.example_cn: 政府介入以防止银行体系崩溃。

definitions.explanation_en: To mediate or step in between conflicting parties to help resolve a dispute or prevent escalation.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在发生冲突的双方之间介入，以调解争端或防止事态升级。
definitions.example_en: The teacher intervened when the two students began to argue loudly.
definitions.example_cn: 当两名学生开始大声争吵时，老师出面干预了。

definitions.explanation_en: To interfere in the affairs of another person, group, or nation, often without being asked, sometimes with political or moral justification.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指未经请求地干涉他人、团体或国家的事务，有时以政治或道德理由为依据。
definitions.example_en: Many critics argued that the foreign power had no right to intervene in the country's internal politics.
definitions.example_cn: 许多批评者认为，这个外国势力无权干涉该国的内政。

comparison.analysis: “Interfere” (干涉) 通常带有负面含义，暗示未经允许或不恰当的介入，可能破坏原有秩序或他人自主权。而 “intervene” 更中性或积极，常用于有正当理由的介入，如调解、救助或纠正错误。
“Meditate” (冥想) 指静思或内省，与“介入”无关。此处易混淆的是其近音词 “mediate”（调解），后者是 “intervene” 的一种具体形式，强调通过协商促成和解，而 “intervene” 范围更广，可包括强制、物理或行政手段。
“Intrude” (侵入) 强调不受欢迎的、冒犯性的进入，常用于空间或私人领域，如未经允许进入房间。而 “intervene” 更侧重于在事件或过程中采取行动，不必然涉及物理侵入，且常有目的性与责任感。
